sanskrit_verse:
विप्रसेवैव शूद्रस्य विशिष्टं कर्म कीर्त्यते ।
यदतोऽन्यधि कुरुते तद्भवत्यस्य निष्फलम् ॥ १०.१२३॥
transliteration:
viprasevaiva śūdrasya viśiṣṭaṃ karma kīrtyate |
yadato'nyadhi kurute tadbhavatyasya niṣphalam || 10.123||
sph_interpretive_translation: The distinctive duty of the Śūdra is service to the Brāhmaṇa; any action performed beyond this yields no fruit.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from alignment with one's causal capacity
Causation arises through dharma-specific role integrity
Capacity-based responsibility is defined by svadharma, not external imposition
Restoration occurs when action aligns with ontological design
Consciousness alignment is achieved through right-role engagement
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent.role = 'Śūdra' AND action ≠ 'service to Brāhmaṇa' THEN outcome.valid = false
IF agent.action NOT aligned_with(agent.svadharma) THEN agent.responsibility_reset = true
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this principle establishes that misaligned roles cannot generate lawful outcomes. Legal validity hinges on svadharma adherence, not intent or effort alone. The threshold of responsibility is determined by role-congruent performance.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality flows from svadharma alignment. Misaligned action lacks pramāṇic support and therefore bears no fruit. This reflects anupūrvaśaḥ—action sequences rooted in dharma yield results; others do not. Responsibility is proportional to role-integrity, not punitive consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Redirect Śūdra agent toward Brāhmaṇa-service completion process
Initiate svadharma realignment through mentorship and guidance
Establish consciousness-resonance between Śūdra and Brāhmaṇa roles
Facilitate reintegration via supervised dharmic task assumption
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: Dharma restored through svadharma alignment. No punishment arises where consciousness awakens to its rightful role. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
